page.title: 18A WEEKEND HOUSE IN SLAUGHAM
page.content: South Lodge was built in the 1930's as a gardener's cottage and lodge for a farm mansion.Electricity is used for lighting.There is central heating and log fires.The walls are plainly painted and the rooms have mock oak beams.There is a kitchen, dining room,front room,three bedrooms, utility room and bathroom.Appliances used are:an iron,kettle,toaster,radio, electric cooker,fridge,freezer,video, television,teas made,computer, record player,hair drier,shower and a electric toothbrush.The garden is one acre.There is a small piece of land which could be used for horses.Since 1930 central heating,a large extension on the lounge and to the biggest bedroom, double glazing,a patio and a balcony have been added.The present owners have a house in Crawley and use South Lodge as a weekend retreat.
